content: Ravi Shankar Rajan — That’s a great point. You’re right that it’s important for the team to have confidence that the outcome will be positive. I agree that it’s risky for the leader to show vulnerability during a storm, but I don’t think we should rule it out. Some storms require the talents and efforts of the entire team, and I think it’s okay to acknowledge that. Overall, I agree that the nuances matter a lot in these circumstances. Great conversation!
